title: Passive attack
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, some [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") possess a **passive attack** - it is used automatically in retaliation to a [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") attack against the monster. They can be avoided by use of [ranged weapons](/wiki/Ranged_weapon "Ranged weapon"), [pounding](/wiki/Pounding "Pounding") with a [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") or [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance"), or being resistant to the attack. Passive attacks are *not* affected by [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation").

The most infamous example of such a passive attack is the [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye")'s [paralysis](/wiki/Paralysis "Paralysis") gaze - hitting a floating eye normally paralyses the player for a period of time, during which they are vulnerable to outside attack - a cause of numerous [YASDs](/wiki/YASD "YASD"). Other well-known examples include the various [jellies](/wiki/Jelly "Jelly"), [puddings](/wiki/Pudding "Pudding"), [molds](/wiki/Mold "Mold") and [acid blobs](/wiki/Acid_blob "Acid blob").

A passive attack is denoted by **AT\_NONE** in the source code.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 List of passive attacks](#List_of_passive_attacks)

  - [1.1 Acid](#Acid)
  - [1.2 Stoning](#Stoning)
  - [1.3 Rust](#Rust)
  - [1.4 Corrosion](#Corrosion)
  - [1.5 Magic missile](#Magic_missile)
  - [1.6 Drain enchantment](#Drain_enchantment)
  - [1.7 Paralysis](#Paralysis)
  - [1.8 Cold](#Cold)
  - [1.9 Stunning](#Stunning)
  - [1.10 Fire](#Fire)
  - [1.11 Electricity](#Electricity)
  - [1.12 Sticky](#Sticky)
  - [1.13 Slime](#Slime)

- [2 References](#References)

## List of passive attacks

Passive attacks against the player are handled in function `passive`. Monsters have at most 1 passive attack, which is defined separately from any other attacks they might have.

### Acid

b [acid blob](/wiki/Acid_blob "Acid blob"), j [spotted jelly](/wiki/Spotted_jelly "Spotted jelly"), j [ochre jelly](/wiki/Ochre_jelly "Ochre jelly"), F [green mold](/wiki/Green_mold "Green mold")

- 50% chance of an [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") damage. If this succeeds, there's a 1/30 chance that your armor is subject to [corrosion](/wiki/Corrosion "Corrosion")
- 1/6 chance, independent of the above, that whatever you attacked with (boot, weapon, etc) is subject to erosion
- Your [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") is [abused](/wiki/Abuse "Abuse")

### Stoning

c [chickatrice](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice"), c [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice")

- If you hit with a bare appendage, you [turn to stone](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") and die instantly (unless stoning resistant)

### Rust

R [rust monster](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster")

- If the monster is [cancelled](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation"), nothing happens
- If you kicked it, your boots suffer the effects of a [rust trap](/wiki/Trap#.5E_Rust_trap "Trap")
- Otherwise, 1/6 chance that your weapon/gloves are subject to [rust](/wiki/Rust "Rust")

### Corrosion

P [black pudding](/wiki/Black_pudding "Black pudding")

- Exactly like the rust attack above, but with the more-powerful corrosion effect

### Magic missile

@ [Oracle (monster)](/wiki/Oracle_\(monster\) "Oracle (monster)") (the source code comment is "wrath of gods for attacking Oracle")[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- If you have magic resistance, no effect
- Else, you are hit with a magic missile attack

### Drain enchantment

R [disenchanter](/wiki/Disenchanter "Disenchanter")

- If the monster is canceled, nothing happens
- If you attacked with an enchanted weapon/boots/gloves, they lose 1 enchantment. [Artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") weapons resist the drain 90% of the time, and ordinary equipment resists 10% of the time.

### Paralysis

b [gelatinous cube](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube"), e [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye")

- If the monster is canceled or dies from the blow, nothing happens
- If you have [free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action"), "You momentarily stiffen"
- If it is a floating eye and you have [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), you cannot see it, or it is [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), nothing happens
- Else, there is a 2/3 chance that you will be paralyzed
- Being frozen by a gelatinous cube abuses [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity")

### Cold

j [blue jelly](/wiki/Blue_jelly "Blue jelly"), F [brown mold](/wiki/Brown_mold "Brown mold")

- If the monster is canceled or dies from the blow, or if you are cold resistant, nothing happens
- Else, there is a 2/3 chance that you suffer a [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") attack
- The monster gains half its attack damage in HP, possibly increasing its max HP
- If the monster's max HP is now high enough, it reproduces

The self-healing makes [blue jellies](/wiki/Blue_jelly "Blue jelly") especially deadly to lower-level characters who can't reliably hit hard enough to offset the healing.

### Stunning

F [yellow mold](/wiki/Yellow_mold "Yellow mold")

- If the monster is canceled or dies from the blow, nothing happens
- 2/3 chance that you become [stunned](/wiki/Stun "Stun")

### Fire

v [fire vortex](/wiki/Fire_vortex "Fire vortex"), E [fire elemental](/wiki/Fire_elemental "Fire elemental"), F [red mold](/wiki/Red_mold "Red mold")

- If the monster is canceled or dies from the blow, or if you are fire resistant nothing happens
- 2/3 chance of [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") damage
- If you are polymorphed into an [iron golem](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem"), you heal by the damage amount, instead

### Electricity

v [energy vortex](/wiki/Energy_vortex "Energy vortex")

- If the monster is canceled or dies from the blow, or if you are shock resistant nothing happens
- 2/3 chance of [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock") damage
- If you are polymorphed into a [flesh golem](/wiki/Flesh_golem "Flesh golem"), you heal by 1/6 of the damage amount

### Sticky

m [large mimic](/wiki/Large_mimic "Large mimic"), m [giant mimic](/wiki/Giant_mimic "Giant mimic")

- If you walk into the mimic without knowing that there is a monster there, you are affected by their [sticking attack](/wiki/Sticking_attack "Sticking attack"), and cannot move away.

### Slime

- Although the [green slime](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime") has a passive [slime](/wiki/Slime "Slime") attack defined, there is no code to handle it.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monattk.h in NetHack 3.4.3, line 12](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/include/monattk.h#line12 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/include/monattk.h")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 2222](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/src/uhitm.c#line2222 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/src/uhitm.c")

Passive attack

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, some monsters possess a passive attack - it is used automatically in retaliation to a melee attack against the monster. They can be avoided by use of ranged weapons, pounding with a polearm or lance, or being resistant to the attack. Passive attacks are not affected by magic cancellation.

The most infamous example of such a passive attack is the floating eye's paralysis gaze - hitting a floating eye normally paralyses the player for a period of time, during which they are vulnerable to outside attack - a cause of numerous YASDs. Other well-known examples include the various jellies, puddings, molds and acid blobs.

A passive attack is denoted by AT_NONE in the source code.[1]
